definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
from the side of the eye/askance

sentences.english: He has been leering at a girl at the next table.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在色迷迷地斜眼看桌边的女孩。

sentences.english: He leered at the girl in pigtails.
sentences.chinese: 他色迷迷的斜眼看着梳辫子的姑娘。

sentences.english: Steamed stuffed bun strabismus, he was aiming at the man.
sentences.chinese: 包子斜眼瞄瞄对方，他是个西装笔挺的男士。

sentences.english: Then you squint over at your alarm clock andrealize you still have 2 more hours to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 然后你斜眼看着闹钟，意识到你还可以睡两个小时。

sentences.english: With half an eye Soapy saw that the policeman was watching him fixedly .
sentences.chinese: 他斜眼望去，看见那个警察正死死盯住他。

sentences.english: When the parents squint the children become cockeyed.
sentences.chinese: 父母视线不正，孩子也变斜眼。
嘴巴半开，稍微地斜眼看。

sentences.english: She poured more tea into her cup, watching its flow sideways.
sentences.chinese: 她又添茶，并斜眼望着茶水从壶嘴往杯子里淌。

sentences.english: She glanced, sideways, at the old couple. Perhaps they would go soon.
sentences.chinese: 她斜眼看了看这对老人，他们也许很快就会走的。

definition: to cast sidelong glances at sb
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to take a furtive look at
to turn one's head/to turn around
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
